title.value: R-U-SURE? Uncertainty-Aware Code Suggestions By Maximizing Utility Across Random User Intents
title.justification: This is the clear, full title given at the top of the research paper.
title.quote: R-U-SURE? Uncertainty-Aware Code Suggestions By Maximizing Utility Across Random User Intents

extractions.description: This paper proposes R-U-SURE, an approach for generating uncertainty-aware code suggestions using a decision-theoretic model of goal-conditioned utility with samples from a generative model acting as proxies for the user's intent. The method combines minimum-Bayes-risk decoding, dual decomposition, and decision diagrams to efficiently provide structured uncertainty summaries for code suggestions. It is implemented as an open-source library and demonstrated on several developer assistance tasks.

type.justification: The paper contains experiments and demonstrations of the proposed method on real-world developer assistance tasks, indicating it is an empirical study rather than purely theoretical.
type.quote: We demonstrate R-U-SURE on three developer-assistance tasks, and show that it can be applied different user interaction patterns without retraining the model and leads to more accurate uncertainty estimates than token-probability baselines.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on generating and evaluating code suggestions to assist software developers, which falls under the broad field of Software Engineering.
name.quote: Large language models show impressive results at predicting structured text such as code, but also commonly introduce errors and hallucinations in their output. When used to assist software developers...

name.justification: The paper leverages machine learning, specifically large language models, to generate code suggestions. This aligns with the subfield of ML4Code.
name.quote: Our key insight is that, since language models of code are trained to predict file contents from context, we can reinterpret the samples from a well-trained language model as plausible goal states for the user.

name.justification: The core contribution of the paper is to introduce mechanisms for capturing and utilizing uncertainty in code suggestions generated by machine learning models.
name.quote: We propose Randomized Utility-driven Synthesis of Uncertain REgions (R-U-SURE), an approach for building uncertainty-aware suggestions based on a decision-theoretic model of goal-conditioned utility, using random samples from a generative model as a proxy for the unobserved possible intents of the end user.

name.justification: R-U-SURE is explicitly mentioned as the central model proposed in the paper which aids in generating uncertainty-aware code suggestions.
name.quote: We propose Randomized Utility-driven Synthesis of Uncertain REgions (R-U-SURE), an approach for building uncertainty-aware suggestions...

is_contributed.justification: R-U-SURE is the primary contribution introduced and developed in the paper.
is_contributed.quote: We propose Randomized Utility-driven Synthesis of Uncertain REgions (R-U-SURE)...

is_executed.justification: The model is discussed in the context of being used within an experimental setup for code completion tasks, but the paper does not explicitly talk about its execution environment (CPU/GPU).
is_executed.quote: We demonstrate R-U-SURE on three developer-assistance tasks...

is_compared.justification: R-U-SURE's performance is evaluated and compared with other baselines in the experiments.
is_compared.quote: We compare our approach to a number of task-specific baselines...

referenced_paper_title.justification: R-U-SURE is a new model proposed in this paper and doesn't reference any prior specific model paper by title.

name.justification: The MBPP dataset is explicitly mentioned as used for experiments in the paper.
name.quote: For the example in the Mostly Basic Python Problems benchmark dataset...

referenced_paper_title.value: Program Synthesis with Large Language Models
referenced_paper_title.justification: The cited reference for the MBPP dataset is the paper 'Program Synthesis with Large Language Models' by Jacob Austin et al.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Austin, J., Odena, A., Nye, M., Bosma, M., Michalewski, H., Dohan, D., Jiang, E., Cai, C. J., Terry, M., Le, Q. V., and Sutton, C. Program synthesis with large language models.

name.justification: The paper mentions the use of a dataset created from permissively licensed code from scientific computing repositories hosted on GitHub.
name.quote: We use permissively licensed code from scientific computing repositories hosted on GitHub.

referenced_paper_title.justification: This dataset is constructed specifically for the purpose of this study and doesn’t reference any prior paper by title.

name.justification: Numba is mentioned as part of the implementation details for the R-U-SURE system, specifically for CPU optimization.
name.quote: Our current implementation of R-U-SURE runs on the CPU using Numba...

referenced_paper_title.value: Numba: A LLVM-based Python JIT Compiler
referenced_paper_title.justification: The cited reference for Numba is the paper 'Numba: A LLVM-based Python JIT Compiler' by Lam et al.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Lam, S. K., Pitrou, A., and Seibert, S. Numba: a llvm-based python jit compiler. In LLVM ’15, 2015.
